Register a function by name
Parameters
in name
Name of the function (if it is NULL, function is not registered into host scope)
in invoke

out func
Will set the pointer to the function if the parameter is not null

Number of function arguments

METACALL_API int metacall_register (const char *name, void *(*invoke)(size_t, void *[], void *), void **func, enum metacall_value_id return_type, size_t size,...)
and arguments @types
Register a function by name
Parameters
in loader
Opaque pointer to the loader in which you want to register the function (this allows to register the function into a different loader than the host)
in handle
Opaque pointer to the handle in which you want to register the function (if it is NULL, it will be defined on the global scope of the loader)
in name
Name of the function (if it is NULL, function is not registered into host scope)
in invoke
Pointer to function invoke interface (argc, argv, data)
in return_type
Type of return value
in size
Number of function arguments
in types
List of parameter types
Returns
Zero if the function was registered properly, distinct from zero otherwise

metacall_log_null() metacall_log_nullmetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_log_null
METACALL_API void metacall_log_null (void )
Disables MetaCall logs, must be called before @metacall_initialize.
When initializing MetaCall, it initializes a default logs to stdout if none was defined. If you want to benchmark or simply disable this default logs, you can call to this function before @metacall_initialize.

metacall_load_from_file() metacall_load_from_filemetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_load_from_file
METACALL_API int metacall_load_from_file (const char * tag, const char * paths[], size_t size, void ** handle)
Loads a script from file specified by @path.
Parameters
in tag
Extension of the script
in paths
Path array of files
in size
Size of the array @paths
in,out handle
Optional pointer to reference of loaded handle. If the parameter is NULL, the symbols loaded are propagated to the loader scope (i.e they will share the scope between all previously loaded files and they can collide). Otherwise, if we pass a void* pointer set to NULL, it will behave as output parameter, obtaining the reference to the created handle, which can be later on used for calling to functions of that handle. The symbols will not be propagated to the loader scope and they will be private (this prevents collisions). The last case is if we pass an already allocated handle (i.e a void* pointer pointing to an previously loaded handle), then in this case, the symbols loaded will be propagated to the previously allocated handle, and it will behave as a in parameter.
Returns
Zero if success, different from zero otherwise
metacall_load_from_memory() metacall_load_from_memorymetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_load_from_memory
METACALL_API int metacall_load_from_memory (const char * tag, const char * buffer, size_t size, void ** handle)
Loads a script from memory.
Parameters
in tag
Extension of the script
in buffer
Memory block representing the string of the script
in size
Memory block representing the string of the script
in,out handle
Optional pointer to reference of loaded handle. If the parameter is NULL, the symbols loaded are propagated to the loader scope (i.e they will share the scope between all previously loaded files and they can collide). Otherwise, if we pass a void* pointer set to NULL, it will behave as output parameter, obtaining the reference to the created handle, which can be later on used for calling to functions of that handle. The symbols will not be propagated to the loader scope and they will be private (this prevents collisions). The last case is if we pass an already allocated handle (i.e a void* pointer pointing to an previously loaded handle), then in this case, the symbols loaded will be propagated to the previously allocated handle, and it will behave as a in parameter.
Returns
Zero if success, different from zero otherwise
metacall_load_from_package() metacall_load_from_packagemetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_load_from_package
METACALL_API int metacall_load_from_package (const char * tag, const char * path, void ** handle)
Loads a package of scrips from file specified by @path into loader defined by @extension.
Parameters
in tag
Extension of the script
in path
Path of the package
in,out handle
Optional pointer to reference of loaded handle. If the parameter is NULL, the symbols loaded are propagated to the loader scope (i.e they will share the scope between all previously loaded files and they can collide). Otherwise, if we pass a void* pointer set to NULL, it will behave as output parameter, obtaining the reference to the created handle, which can be later on used for calling to functions of that handle. The symbols will not be propagated to the loader scope and they will be private (this prevents collisions). The last case is if we pass an already allocated handle (i.e a void* pointer pointing to an previously loaded handle), then in this case, the symbols loaded will be propagated to the previously allocated handle, and it will behave as a in parameter.
Returns
Zero if success, different from zero otherwise
metacall_load_from_configuration() metacall_load_from_configurationmetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_load_from_configuration
METACALL_API int metacall_load_from_configuration (const char * path, void ** handle, void * allocator)
Loads a a list of scrips from configuration specified by @path into loader with the following format: { "language_id": "<tag>", "path": "<path>", "scripts": [ "<script0>", "<script1>", ..., "<scriptN>" ] }.
Parameters
in path
Path of the configuration
in,out handle
Optional pointer to reference of loaded handle. If the parameter is NULL, the symbols loaded are propagated to the loader scope (i.e they will share the scope between all previously loaded files and they can collide). Otherwise, if we pass a void* pointer set to NULL, it will behave as output parameter, obtaining the reference to the created handle, which can be later on used for calling to functions of that handle. The symbols will not be propagated to the loader scope and they will be private (this prevents collisions). The last case is if we pass an already allocated handle (i.e a void* pointer pointing to an previously loaded handle), then in this case, the symbols loaded will be propagated to the previously allocated handle, and it will behave as a in parameter.
in allocator
Pointer to allocator will allocate the configuration
Returns
Zero if success, different from zero otherwise

METACALL_API int metacall_register_loaderv (void * loader, void * handle, const char * name, void *(*)(size_t, void *[], void *) invoke, enum metacall_value_id return_type, size_t size, enum metacall_value_id types[])
metacall_await() metacall_awaitmetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_await
METACALL_API void* metacall_await (const char * name, void * args[], void *(*)(void *, void *) resolve_callback, void *(*)(void *, void *) reject_callback, void * data)
Executes an asynchronous call to the function and registers a callback to be executed when a future is resolved (it does block)
Parameters
in name
The name of the function to be called asynchronously
in args
Array of pointers to the values to be passed to the function
in resolve_callback
Pointer to function that will be executed when task completion
in void
* Value representing the result of the future resolution
in void
* A reference to @data that will be used as a closure for the chain
Returns
Value containing the result of the operation, it will be wrapped into a future later on to be returned by the function
Parameters
in reject_callback
Pointer to function that will be executed when task error (signature is identical as resolve_callback)
in data
Pointer to a context that will act as a closure for the chain
Returns
Pointer to value containing the result of the call returned by @resolve_callback or @reject_callback wrapped in a future
metacall_await_future() metacall_await_futuremetacall.h metacall.hmetacall_await_future
METACALL_API void* metacall_await_future (void * f, void *(*)(void *, void *) resolve_callback, void *(*)(void *, void *) reject_callback, void * data)
Awaits for a promise and registers a callback to be executed when a future is resolved.
Parameters
in f
The pointer to the future
in resolve_callback
Pointer to function that will be executed when task completion
in void
* Value representing the result of the future resolution
in void
* A reference to @data that will be used as a closure for the chain
Returns
Value containing the result of the operation, it will be wrapped into a future later on to be returned by the function
Parameters
in reject_callback
Pointer to function that will be executed when task error (signature is identical as resolve_callback)
in data
Pointer to a context that will act as a closure for the chain
Returns
Pointer to value containing the result of the call returned by @resolve_callback or @reject_callback wrapped in a future
